Class PasswordValidatorTest

java.lang.Object
password.PasswordValidatorTest
@TestMethodOrder(org.junit.jupiter.api.MethodOrderer.OrderAnnotation.class) public class PasswordValidatorTest extends Object
Unit tests for the PasswordValidator class.

This test class verifies the correct functionality of the validatePassword method by checking various valid and invalid password inputs according to defined criteria.

Author:
Dhruv

  • Method Details

    • testEmptyPassword

      @Test @Order(1) public void testEmptyPassword()
      Tests the validatePassword method with an empty password string. Expects an IllegalArgumentException to be thrown.

    • testValidPassword

      @Test @Order(2) public void testValidPassword()
      Tests the validatePassword method with a valid password. Ensures no exception is thrown for a properly formatted password.

    • testMissingUppercase

      @Test @Order(3) public void testMissingUppercase()
      Tests the validatePassword method with a password missing an uppercase letter. Expects an IllegalArgumentException to be thrown.

    • testMissingLowercase

      @Test @Order(4) public void testMissingLowercase()
      Tests the validatePassword method with a password missing a lowercase letter. Expects an IllegalArgumentException to be thrown.

    • testMissingDigit

      @Test @Order(5) public void testMissingDigit()
      Tests the validatePassword method with a password missing a numeric digit. Expects an IllegalArgumentException to be thrown.

    • testMissingSpecial

      @Test @Order(6) public void testMissingSpecial()
      Tests the validatePassword method with a password missing a special character. Expects an IllegalArgumentException to be thrown.

    • testTooShortPassword

      @Test @Order(7) public void testTooShortPassword()
      Tests the validatePassword method with a password that is too short. Expects an IllegalArgumentException to be thrown.
